00020 
00021 # After this function is called, the image has been sent to the client. Do not print anything after.
00022 function renderGauge($datacolumn, $dataname, $datamin, $datamax, $renderval, $extra) {
00023     # Number of numbers to draw on the gauge
00024     $divisions = 7;
00025 
00026     # Border around the dial on the image [the divisions go here]
00027     $imageborder = 40;
00028 
00029     # Radius of dial
00030     $gaugeradius = 40;
00031 
00032     $gaugewidth = 2 * $gaugeradius;
00033     $gaugeheight = $gaugeradius;
00034     $imagewidth = $gaugewidth + 2 * $imageborder;
00035     $imageheight = $gaugeheight + 2 * $imageborder;
00036     $gaugecenterx = $imagewidth / 2;
00037     $gaugecentery = $imageheight - $imageborder;
00038     $textradius = $gaugeheight + 20;
00039     $dialradius = $gaugeheight - 20;
00040 
00041     $font = 1; # Passed to imagestring()
00042 
00043     $im = imagecreate($imagewidth,$imageheight);
00044     $black = imagecolorallocate ($im,0x00,0x00,0x00);
00045     $white = imagecolorallocate ($im,0xff,0xff,0xff);
00046     imagefilledrectangle($im,0,0,$imagewidth,$imageheight,$white);
00047 
00048     imagearc($im, $gaugecenterx, $gaugecentery, $gaugewidth, $gaugeheight*2, 180, 0, $black);
00049 
00050     for($i=0;$i<=$divisions;$i++) {
00051         $angle = (M_PI/180) * (180 + 180 * $i / $divisions);
00052         $showval = $datamin + $i * ($datamax - $datamin) / $divisions;
00053         $xpos = $gaugecenterx + $textradius * cos($angle);
00054         $ypos = $gaugecentery + $textradius * sin($angle);
00055         imagestring($im, $font, $xpos, $ypos, round($showval, 0), $black);
00056     }
00057 
00058     $centerstr = "$dataname : $renderval";
00059 
00060     imagestring($im, $font, $imageborder, $gaugecentery + 10, $centerstr, $black);
00061     if(!empty($extra) && strlen($extra)) {
00062         imagestring($im, $font, 2*$imageborder, 2*$imageborder, $extra, $black);
00063     }
00064 
00065     $angle = (M_PI/180) * (180 + (180 * ($renderval - $datamin) / ($datamax - $datamin)));
00066     # imagestring($im, $font, $width/2, 30, $angle, $black);
00067 
00068     $endx = $gaugecenterx + $dialradius * cos($angle);
00069     $endy = $gaugecentery + $dialradius * sin($angle);
00070 
00071     imageline($im, $endx, $endy, $gaugecenterx, $gaugecentery, $black);
00072 
00073 
00074     header("Content-type: image/png");
00075     imagepng($im);
00076 }
00077 
00078 ?>
